titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices of Ireland, a proclamation. Sydney, Tho: Coningsby. Being certainly informed that several souldiers of their Majesties army in Ireland do dayly desert their colours and by confederacy with masters and owners of ships and vessells and other seafaring men transport themseves [sic] into England ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

titleStmt.title: By the Lords Justices of Ireland, a proclamation. Sydney, Tho: Coningsby. Being certainly informed that several souldiers of their Majesties army in Ireland do dayly desert their colours and by confederacy with masters and owners of ships and vessells and other seafaring men transport themseves [sic] into England ...
titleStmt.author: Ireland. Lords Justices and Council.
Coningsby, Thomas Coningsby, Earl, 1656?-1729.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Andrew Crook, assign of Benjamin Took, printer to the King and Queen at their Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key,

notesStmt.note: "Given at their Majesties castle of Dublin this 19 day of September 1690.".
Steele notation: Arms 201. Souldiers in Dulbin.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
